channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Micron Needs a New Memory Boost
item.description: Worries about PC and smartphone demand have pushed down the memory-chip maker’s stock, offsetting an AI lift.

item.title: This chart shows gold vs. the stock market since Bernanke’s famous helicopter drop speech
item.description: “In short, market participants seem to agree with this thesis—in a world in which the government decides to keep the economy going via heavy fiscal sp...

item.title: Here's What Happens to Markets When Interest Rates Fall, in Charts
item.description: History shows some of the prospects for stocks, bonds and other investments after the Fed begins to cut rates.

item.title: Train singer Pat Monahan lists lakeside mansion in Washington for $8.2 million
item.description: The beautiful lakefront home in Issaquah, Wash., overlooks the waters of Lake Sammamish.

item.title: America's Ambitious Climate Plan Is Faltering
item.description: Global emissions are at records, and the shift away from fossil fuels is slowing amid high costs and surging power demand.

item.title: ‘Selling Sunset’ fans want to know: Are the stars actual real estate agents, and who sells the most?
item.description: The popular Netflix reality series follows L.A. real estate agents as they market lavish megahomes in Southern California.

item.title: South Korea Can Go Only So Far Copying Japan's Market Reforms
item.description: Returns might improve, but the power of chaebols—including Samsung and Hyundai—will limit the gains.

item.title: News Corp’s REA submits improved $8.1 billion bid for U.K.’s Rightmove
item.description: The improved offer would see REA Group pay a 9.2% higher price than the one it originally offered to pay in its Sept. 5 bid

item.title: The Rate Cut Happened. Not All Borrowing Costs Are Going Down.
item.description: The yield on 10-year Treasury notes is a reminder that the Fed doesn’t have complete control over borrowing costs.

item.title: ‘We have no health insurance’: My wife died, leaving behind a lot of medical debt. Am I responsible?
